meanings.sent1: The small village formed a peaceful regnum in the valley.
meanings.sent2: The regnum was known for its lush forests and sparkling rivers.
meanings.sent3: In the regnum of ants, the queen ruled with grace and wisdom.
meanings.sent4: The regnum of books held endless adventures within its pages.
meanings.sent5: The regnum of dreams was filled with fantastical creatures and magical landscapes.

meanings.definition: The rule or reign of a monarch.
meanings.sent1: The regnum of the wise king brought prosperity to the land.
meanings.sent2: During the regnum of Queen Elizabeth, England flourished.
meanings.sent3: The regnum of the playful kitten over the household was full of mischief.
meanings.sent4: Under the regnum of the sun, the flowers bloomed brightly.
meanings.sent5: The regnum of the storm brought chaos and destruction to the coastal town.

meanings.definition: A period of time during which a monarch rules.
meanings.sent1: The regnum of winter covered the land in a blanket of snow.
meanings.sent2: During the regnum of the pharaohs, Egypt saw great architectural achievements.
meanings.sent3: The regnum of naptime was a peaceful break for the tired toddler.
meanings.sent4: In the regnum of exams, students studied diligently to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The regnum of summer brought warmth and long sunny days to the countryside.
